page.title: 04FARMING IN ONGAR
page.content: There are 13 farms in this area. They are mostly about 200 acres on gently sloping land.The highest point in this area is 80m above sea level. The fields are of different sizes ranging from 3 or 4 acres to about 40. They are still separated with hedges in some farms but there is little woodland on most. The main crop is usually wheat. Barley, oilseed rape, peas and Durum wheat are grown as well. { Some farmers}are trying to{cut down on the{chemicals}they use for these crops , as they are polluting the nearby rivers. The owners generally employ one or two part-time and full-time workers. Extra workers are employed at harvest time.
